data.title: Brian O'Brien Named as New Ireland Manager
data.meta_description: The Irish Rugby Football Union is pleased to announce that Brian O’Brien has been appointed as Manager of the Irish…
data.text: The Irish Rugby Football Union is pleased to announce that Brian O’Brien has been appointed as Manager of the Irish senior team to the end of season 2000 – 2001. A former Irish international center, capped against France, England and Scotland in 1967-68, Brian O’Brien is the current Manager of Heineken European Cup semi-finalists Munster. A member of Shannon R.F.C. since 1955, he has been involved with the Limerick Club ever since as player, coach and Manager and as Club President in 1984, 85 and 86. He is a former Munster, Ireland and Lions selector and was Manager of the Ireland under 21 team in 1992, 93 and 94. He says: “I am absolutely delighted to be named as Manager of the Irish team. It is a tremendous honour and I am looking forward to working with Warren Garland and Eddie O’Sullivan and the other Management team at this very exciting time in Irish rugby.” For further information please contact Slattery PR (Press Office for IRU): Tel: +353 1 661 4055.
